events.originalText: An estimated worldwide television audience of 750 million watched the wedding of Prince Charles and Lady Diana Spencer at St Paul's Cathedral in London.
events.subtitle: Wedding of Prince Charles and Lady Diana Spencer
events.headline: 750 Million Watch Prince Charles and Lady Diana's Wedding at St Paul's Cathedral

events.originalText: The Fellowship of the Ring, the first part of J. R. R. Tolkien's high-fantasy novel The Lord of the Rings, was published by Allen & Unwin.
events.subtitle: The Fellowship of the Ring
events.headline: Fellowship of the Ring Published by Allen & Unwin

events.originalText: Korean War: Over fears that North Korean soldiers were infiltrating refugee columns, U.S. forces concluded a four-day massacre of hundreds of civilians through shootings and air attacks near the village of No Gun Ri.
events.subtitle: Korean War
events.headline: US Forces Massacre Civilians Near No Gun Ri in Korean War

events.originalText: The Essential Commodities Reserves Act, which allowed the British government to build up reserves of essential commodities in anticipation of war, received royal assent.
events.subtitle: Essential Commodities Reserves Act 1938
events.headline: Essential Commodities Reserves Act Receives Royal Assent

events.originalText: The Yomiuri Shimbun reported that up to 100 Korean workers who were constructing a hydroelectric plant on the Shinano River in Japan had been murdered and thrown into the river.
events.subtitle: Yomiuri Shimbun
events.headline: Up to 100 Korean Workers Murdered in Japan, Yomiuri Shimbun Reports

events.originalText: The first shots of World War I were fired by the Austro-Hungarian river monitor SMS Bodrog on Serbian defences near Belgrade.
events.subtitle: River monitor
events.headline: First Shots of World War I Fired by SMS Bodrog on Serbian Defences

events.originalText: The Cape Cod Canal, connecting Cape Cod Bay and Buzzards Bay in the U.S. state of Massachusetts, opened on a limited basis.
events.subtitle: Cape Cod Canal
events.headline: Cape Cod Canal Opens on Limited Basis in Massachusetts

events.originalText: Italian-American anarchist Gaetano Bresci assassinated King Umberto I of Italy in Monza.
events.subtitle: Gaetano Bresci
events.headline: King Umberto I of Italy Assassinated by Gaetano Bresci in Monza

events.originalText: Italian-American anarchist Gaetano Bresci assassinated King Umberto I of Italy in Monza.
events.subtitle: Gaetano Bresci
events.headline: Confederate Spy Belle Boyd Arrested by Union Forces

events.originalText: American Civil War: Confederate spy Belle Boyd was arrested by Union forces after her lover turned her in.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: French Physicist Fresnel Submits Memoir on Light Diffraction

events.originalText: French physicist Augustin-Jean Fresnel submitted a memoir on the diffraction of light to the Royal Academy of Sciences, providing strong support for the wave theory of light.
events.subtitle: Augustin-Jean Fresnel
events.headline: French Troops Defeat Grand Alliance Forces at Battle of Landen

events.originalText: Nine Years' War: French troops defeated the forces of the Grand Alliance led by William III of England at the Battle of Landen in present-day Neerwinden, Belgium.
events.subtitle: Nine Years' War
events.headline: Byzantine Forces Defeat Bulgarian Troops at Battle of Kleidion

events.originalText: Byzantine–Bulgarian wars: Byzantine forces defeated troops of the Bulgarian Empire at the Battle of Kleidion (pictured) in the mountains of Belasica near present-day Klyuch.
events.subtitle: Byzantine–Bulgarian wars
